ARTICLE 7 - LICENSE TO PROGRAM RESULTS
7.01
Grants to FCE of Program Results.
(a)
FCE’s R&D Rights. ExxonMobil grants FCE a worldwide, non-exclusive, royalty-free, non-transferable (except
pursuant to Article 14 (Assignment)), non-sub-licensable (except as set forth in this Paragraph 7.01(a)) right and
license to practice Program Results solely to conduct research and development for the Program. More
particularly, said right and license to practice includes the right to use, reproduce, and create derivative works of
Program Information under applicable copyrights and to make, use, and import (but not sell or offer to sell) under
the claims of Program Patents, in each case solely for research and development for the Program. Said right and
license may be extended to contractors performing work on behalf of FCE but is not otherwise sub-licensable.

ARTICLE 7 - LICENSE TO PROGRAM RESULTS

Grants to FCE of Program Results.

license to practice Program Results solely to conduct research and development for the Program. More
particularly, said right and license to practice includes the right to use, reproduce, and create derivative works of

perturbation.explanation: The original text states that the license to practice Program Results for R&D is 'non-sub-licensable (except as set forth in this Paragraph 7.01(a))' and may be extended to contractors but is 'not otherwise sub-licensable'. The modified version removes the restriction that it may be extended to contractors and inserts 'is otherwise sub-licensable with written consent from ExxonMobil,' which directly contradicts the non-sub-licensable clause and creates uncertainty regarding the sub-licensing rights.

perturbation.original_text:
ARTICLE 12 - TERM AND TERMINATION
12.02
Early Termination. The Parties recognize that circumstances may arise where this Agreement’s early termination would
be desirable. Accordingly, either Party may terminate this Agreement or all/part of a Project for any reason and at any time
upon giving the other Party sixty (60) days prior written notice. In the event of early termination of a Project or this
Agreement. In addition, if this Agreement is terminated by ExxonMobil, ExxonMobil will pay FCE reasonable non-
refundable expenses incurred by FCE in satisfying authorized commitments entered into by FCE with third parties prior to
receipt of the termination notice. FCE will uses its best efforts to minimize termination expenses and will give appropriate
credit to ExxonMobil where applicable. The total amount paid FCE under this Agreement or for a Project, including all
amounts paid following termination, will not exceed the maximum authorized charge specified in this Agreement or for a
Project.
perturbation.changed_text:
ARTICLE 12 - TERM AND TERMINATION
12.02
Early Termination. The Parties recognize that circumstances may arise where this Agreement’s early termination would
be desirable. Accordingly, either Party may terminate this Agreement or all/part of a Project for any reason and at any time
upon giving the other Party sixty (60) days prior written notice. In the event of early termination of a Project or this
Agreement. In addition, if this Agreement is terminated by ExxonMobil, ExxonMobil will pay FCE a termination fee of $10,000. The total amount paid FCE under this Agreement or for a Project, including all
amounts paid following termination, may exceed the maximum authorized charge specified in this Agreement or for a
Project.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies that in case of early termination ExxonMobil is responsible for the reasonable non-refundable expenses incurred by FCE. This is modified to say ExxonMobil will only be responsible for a termination fee of $10,000, which could be significantly lower than reasonable expenses, creating a contradiction. Furthermore, the original text caps expenses to the maximum authorized charge while the modified version allows that limit to be exceeded.

perturbation.original_text:
ARTICLE 6 - OWNERSHIP / PROCUREMENT OF PROGRAM RESULTS
6.01
Ownership of Program Results. ExxonMobil will solely own Program Information, Program Patents, and copyrightable
works resulting from the Program (collectively, “Program Results”), irrespective of whether the Program Results are
conceived, created, developed or acquired by employees or other representatives of FCE, ExxonMobil, or both. FCE will
assign, and hereby assigns, to ExxonMobil ownership of Program Results.
perturbation.changed_text:
ARTICLE 6 - OWNERSHIP / PROCUREMENT OF PROGRAM RESULTS
6.01
Ownership of Program Results. ExxonMobil will solely own Program Information, Program Patents, and copyrightable
works resulting from the Program (collectively, “Program Results”), irrespective of whether the Program Results are
conceived, created, developed or acquired by employees or other representatives of FCE, ExxonMobil, or both. FCE will
assign, and hereby assigns, to ExxonMobil ownership of Program Results, except in circumstances where ExxonMobil provides written notice waiving its rights to ownership.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states unequivocally that ExxonMobil will solely own the Program Results and that FCE assigns ownership. The modified text adds an exception: 'except in circumstances where ExxonMobil provides written notice waiving its rights to ownership.' This creates a direct contradiction, as it's now unclear under what conditions ExxonMobil will actually own the Program Results. It introduces uncertainty because ownership is no longer automatic and is subject to ExxonMobil's discretionary waiver.
